channel.title: NPC Drops [PI] Explicity source
channel.description: how do i add npc drops?

item.title: NPC Drops [PI] Explicity source
item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568
item.description:
@bob2568 wrote:

[quote=“adamgulka, post:3, topic:519690”][quote author=bob2568 link=topic=638185.msg4301275#msg4301275 date=1369036880]
if your on a pi, idk which but try going to your yourserver/data/cfg folder, and click npcdrops.tsm, heres an example of how it works

#YourNpcName
2636:92 <— “2636 = npcID” “92 = the amount of kills it averages dropping a rare”

Top row is normal drops, something you would get often,
557:2000 1632:25 0995:20000 536:1 568:20 570:20 575:20 572:20 574:20

Bottom row is rare drops, the this is how it works #itemid:quantity
13362:1 13358:1 15241:1 13896:1 13884:1 13890:1 19780:1 15243:3000 11286:1 537:100 0995:250000000

thats an example, not sure if that will help at all.
[/quote]

This is what a few of my drops are

#Man drops 1:1 995:100 554:100 #Guard drops 9:1 995:200 555:100 #general graardor 6260:25 829:1 391:2 385:2 564:50 1249:1 3052:3 892:75 1303:1 808:100 1602:3 1917:1 1971:1 1514:16 1319:1 1275:1 3024:3 1606:3 454:150 560:100 563:50 561:75 1373:1 1127:1 5300:2 2440:3 1604:3 1452:1 995:100000 1149:1 830:5 1079:1 886:100 1608:3 11712:1 11728:1 11714:1 11724:1 11704:1 11710:1

And i have alot of them, but the npc’s dont drop anything?!? it all looks right, but it doesnt work…[/quote]

Check all tabbing between the codes, it runs with the server so so compiling wont give you an error if its there, also check some of the npc ids.

#npcdrops npcid:rare rate

make sure the id is the correct npc…

Read full topic

Bottom row is rare drops, the this is how it works #itemid:quantity
13362:1 13358:1 15241:1 13896:1 13884:1 13890:1 19780:1 15243:3000 11286:1 537:100 0995:250000000
